item.description:
Bring your binoculars for a day of raptor spotting and monadnock hiking.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Every autumn, Audubon Society experts staff mountain observatories counting hawks, eagles, and other birds of prey on their annual migrations.  This site near Peterborough, New Hampshire is one of the premier locations, routinely totalling over 10,000 sightings each season.

We'll have an easy 1.4 mile hike up the mountain where we'll scan the skies for falcons and eagles, before continuing on for another few miles into an adjacent wildlife refuge.   Audubon volunteers will be on hand at the summit sharing their knowledge of raptor migrations, identifications, and predations!

This day is special because injured raptors are scheduled to be re-released into the wild.  Come participate in this exciting event and see some of these majestic birds up close!

After we send the hawks on their way, we'll continue on into the Wapack National Wildlife Refuge, hiking to another nearby peak for views of Vermont, the White Mountains, and sometimes, Boston.  This will be an easy to moderate hike of about 7-8 miles r/t (half that if you drive up the mountain).

Post-Meetup Meetup: After our hike, we'll head into the quintessential New England village of Peterborough (Thornton Wilder's, Our Town) for a pint and dinner at Harlow's Pub.  Harlow's is a homey, British/Irish-style pub with hearty, inexpensive food and live music.

   This is going to be an excellent day all-around!

              ~ Don't miss it! ~

Carpool: Once I see where everyone is coming from, I'll choose a carpool site.   Miller State Park is about 1.5 hours from Seacoast, NH and the North Shore.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Raptors are birds of prey that include everything from the robin-sized Kestrel, to Peregrine Falcons, Turkey Vultures, and Bald Eagles.  Hawks are a specific group withing the raptor class with colorful names such as Goshawk, Northern Harrier, Red-Tailed, Sharp-Shinned, and Merlin.

*Geologically speaking, monadnocks are isolated mountains that rise above a relatively flat surrounding plain, often due to erosion of the surrounding material.  The word was borrowed from the names of several New Hampshire mountains with that characteristic: Mt. (Grand) Monadnock, Pack Monadnock, & North Pack Monadnock.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing.  Fee is for meetup site expenses and planning.  This is not a guided tour.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at Miller State Park - Route 101 parking area - Wapack Trailhead
item.name: Raptor Release & Hawk Watch Hike!
